title: FBI arrests Brian Cole Jr for pipe bombs at party offices
snippets: The FBI has spent years searching for the person who put bombs near the Democratic and Republican committee headquarters, hours before the assault on the Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021.
FBI arrests suspect in Jan. 6 eve pipe bomb case Axios
Authorities have made an arrest in connection with the placement of two pipe bombs outside RNC and DNC headquarters the night before the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol attack.
Investigators have been working to crack the case for almost five years.
The bombs were planted before Jan. 6, 2021, when President Donald Trump's supporters stormed the Capitol as Congress met to confirm Joe Biden's electoral win.

Bombs were placed near Republican and Democratic party HQs in Washington night before US Capitol attack US authorities on Thursday made an arrest in connection with pipe bombs that were planted outside the headquarters of both the Democratic and Republican parties in Washington DC on the eve of 6 Ja
The suspect in custody has been identified as Brian Cole Jr., according to U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi, who said he has been charged with the use of an explosive device.

summary: The FBI has arrested Brian Cole Jr. in connection with the placement of pipe bombs outside the Democratic and Republican party headquarters in Washington, D.C., on January 5, 2021, the night before the Capitol attack. U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi stated that Cole has been charged with the use of an explosive device. Authorities had been investigating the case for nearly five years before the arrest.

title: Old volcano eruption may have helped start Black Death in Europe

After the Milwaukee Bucks star went down with a non-contact injury on Wednesday, ESPN’s Shams Charania reported on Thursday that Antetokounmpo will be sidelined for two-to-four weeks with a right calf strain. The injury occurred only minutes into the first quarter of Wednesday’s game against the Detroit Pistons. After a bucket from AJ Green on an assist from Antetokounmpo, the Greek superstar began jogging back down the floor and suddenly went down to the floor, grabbing at his right leg. title: Amazon will sell new Kindle Scribe tablets on December 10
snippets: Amazon has finally given a release date for its new Kindle Scribe Colorsoft and Kindle Scribe: They’ll be available to purchase starting on December 10th, Amazon spokesperson Rachel Erickson tells The Verge. They’ll cost the same as what Amazon announced back in September: $629.99 for the Colorsoft
The new Kindle Scribe has a larger 11-inch glare-free display, is just 5.4 mm thick, and weighs only 400 g. It’s also 40% faster when writing or turning pages.
